original: Majjhima Nikāya 107
analyzed: majjhima nikāya
translated: Middle Length Discourses

original: Gaṇakamoggallānasutta
analyzed: gaṇaka moggallāna sutta
translated: With Gaṅgaka Moggallāna

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati pubbārāme migāramātupāsāde.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati pubbārāme migāra mātu pāsāde
translated: Once the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Park.

original: Atha kho gaṇakamoggallāno brāhmaṇo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṁ sammodi.
analyzed: atha khalu gaṇakamoggallānaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhim sammodi
translated: Then the brahmin Gaṅgaka Moggallāna went up to the Buddha and exchanged greetings with him.

original: Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho gaṇakamoggallāno brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho gaṇakamoggallānaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side and said to the Buddha:

original: “Seyyathāpi, bho gotama, imassa migāramātupāsādassa dissati anupubbasikkhā anupubbakiriyā anupubbapaṭipadā yadidaṁ—🔽yāva pacchimasopānakaḷevarā;
analyzed: seyyathā api bho gotama imassa migāra mātu pāsādassa dissati anupubba sikkhā anupubba kiriyā anupubba paṭipadā yat idam  yāva pacchima sopāna kaḷevarā
translated: “Master Gotama, it’s as if there were a staircase to a lofty building in the right place for ascent. 🔽But when a man climbs up it to look down on the countryside, he doesn’t see it.

original: imesampi hi, bho gotama, brāhmaṇānaṁ dissati anupubbasikkhā anupubbakiriyā anupubbapaṭipadā yadidaṁ—
analyzed: imesam pi hi bho gotama brāhmaṇānam dissati anupubba sikkhā anupubba kiriyā anupubba paṭipadā yat idam
translated: In the same way, Master Gotama, it’s as if there were a staircase to a lofty building in the right place for ascent.

original: ajjhene;
analyzed: ajjhene
translated: But when a man climbs up it to look down on the countryside, he doesn’t see it.

original: imesampi hi, bho gotama, issāsānaṁ dissati anupubbasikkhā anupubbakiriyā anupubbapaṭipadā yadidaṁ—
analyzed: imesam pi hi bho gotama issāsānam dissati anupubba sikkhā anupubba kiriyā anupubba paṭipadā yat idam
translated: For these archers, too, there is a gradual training, a gradual practice, and a gradual progress,

original: issatthe.
analyzed: is s atthe
translated: in archery.

original: Amhākampi hi, bho gotama, gaṇakānaṁ gaṇanājīvānaṁ dissati anupubbasikkhā anupubbakiriyā anupubbapaṭipadā yadidaṁ—
analyzed: amhākam pi hi bho gotama gaṇakānam gaṇanājīvānam dissati anupubba sikkhā anupubba kiriyā anupubba paṭipadā yat idam
translated: For us accountants, too, there is a gradual training, a gradual practice, and a gradual progress,

original: saṅkhāne.
analyzed: saṅkhāne
translated: in calculation.

original: Mayañhi, bho gotama, antevāsiṁ labhitvā paṭhamaṁ evaṁ gaṇāpema:
analyzed: mayan hi bho gotama antevāsim labhitvā paṭhamam evam
translated: For when we get a student, we first make him count:🔽‘One is one, two is two, three is three, four is four, five is five.’

original: ‘ekaṁ ekakaṁ, dve dukā, tīṇi tikā, cattāri catukkā, pañca pañcakā, cha chakkā, satta sattakā, aṭṭha aṭṭhakā, nava navakā, dasa dasakā’ti;🔽satampi mayaṁ, bho gotama, gaṇāpema, bhiyyopi gaṇāpema.
analyzed: ekaṃ ekaka dve dukā tīṇi tikā cattāri catukkā pañca pañcakā cha chakkā satta sattakā aṭṭha aṭṭhakā nava navakā dasa dasakā ati  bhiyyas pi gaṇāpema
translated: We make him count up to ten.

original: Sakkā nu kho, bho gotama, imasmimpi dhammavinaye evameva anupubbasikkhā anupubbakiriyā anupubbapaṭipadā paññapetun”ti?
analyzed: sakkā nu kho bho gotama imasmim pi dhamma vinaye evam eva anupubba sikkhā anupubba kiriyā anupubba paṭipadā paññapetunti
translated: Is it possible, Master Gotama, to describe a gradual training, a gradual practice, and a gradual progress in this Dhamma and Discipline?”

original: “Sakkā, brāhmaṇa, imasmimpi dhammavinaye anupubbasikkhā anupubbakiriyā anupubbapaṭipadā paññapetuṁ.
analyzed: sakkā brāhmaṇaḥ imasmim pi dhamma vinaye anupubba sikkhā anupubba kiriyā anupubba paṭipadā paññapetu
translated: “Brahmin, it is possible to point out the gradual training, the gradual practice, and the gradual progress in this Dhamma and Discipline.

original: Seyyathāpi, brāhmaṇa, dakkho assadammako bhaddaṁ assājānīyaṁ labhitvā paṭhameneva mukhādhāne kāraṇaṁ kāreti, atha uttariṁ kāraṇaṁ kāreti;
analyzed: seyyathā api brāhmaṇa dakkhaḥ assa dammakaḥ bhaddam assājānīyam labhitvā paṭhamena iva mukhādhāne kāraṇam kāreti atha uttarim kāraṇam kāreti
translated: Suppose a skilled horse-trainer obtains a fine thoroughbred horse and first makes him get used to wearing the bit.

original: evameva kho, brāhmaṇa, tathāgato purisadammaṁ labhitvā paṭhamaṁ evaṁ vineti:
analyzed: evam eva kho brāhmaṇa tathāgataḥ purisa dammam labhitvā paṭhamam evam vinā iti
translated: In the same way, when the Tathāgata obtains a person to be tamed, he first trains him thus:

original: ‘ehi tvaṁ, bhikkhu, sīlavā hohi, pātimokkhasaṁvarasaṁvuto viharāhi ācāragocarasampanno aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvī, samādāya sikkhassu sikkhāpadesū’ti.
analyzed: ehi tva bhikkhu sīlavā hohi pātimokkha savara savutaḥ viharāhi ācāra gocara sampannaḥ aṇumattesu vajjesu bhaya dassāvī samādāya sikkhassu sikkhāpadesu uti
translated: ‘Come, bhikkhu, be virtuous, restrained with the restraint of the Patimokkha, be perfect in conduct and resort, and seeing fear in the slightest fault, train by undertaking the training precepts.’

original: Yato kho, brāhmaṇa, bhikkhu sīlavā hoti, pātimokkhasaṁvarasaṁvuto viharati ācāragocarasampanno
analyzed: yatas kho brāhmaṇa bhikkhu sīlavā hoti pātimokkha savara savutaḥ viharati ācāra gocara sampannaḥ
translated: “When a bhikkhu is virtuous, restrained with the restraint of the Patimokkha, perfect in conduct and resort,

original: aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvī, samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu, tamenaṁ tathāgato uttariṁ vineti:
analyzed: aṇu mattesu vajjesu bhaya dassāvī samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu tam enam tathāgataḥ uttarim vineti
translated: seeing fear in the slightest fault, and having undertaken the training precepts, trains in them, then the Tathāgata trains him further:

original: ‘ehi tvaṁ, bhikkhu, indriyesu guttadvāro hohi, cakkhunā rūpaṁ disvā mā nimittaggāhī hohi mānubyañjanaggāhī.
analyzed: ehi tva bhikkhu indriyesu gutta dvāraḥ hohi cakkhunā rūpam disvā mā nimitta ggāhī hohi mā anubyañjana ggāhī
translated: ‘Come, monk, be guarded over the doors of your senses. On seeing a form with the eye, don’t grasp at its signs and features.

original: Yatvādhikaraṇamenaṁ cakkhundriyaṁ asaṁvutaṁ viharantaṁ abhijjhādomanassā pāpakā akusalā
analyzed: yatvā adhikaraṇam enam cakkhu indriyam asavutam viharantam abhijjhā domanassā pāpakāḥ akusalāḥ
translated: If you don’t guard your eye faculty, desire and aversion will overwhelm that faculty, and with the faculty unguarded, evil unskillful qualities such as greed and aversion will overwhelm you.

original: dhammā anvāssaveyyuṁ tassa saṁvarāya paṭipajjāhi; rakkhāhi cakkhundriyaṁ, cakkhundriye saṁvaraṁ āpajjāhi.
analyzed: dhammāḥ anvāssaveyyum tassa savarāya paṭipajjāhi rakkhāhi cakkhundriya cakkhundriye savaram āpajjāhi
translated: So practice for its restraint, guard the eye faculty, and undertake the restraint of the eye faculty.

original: Sotena saddaṁ sutvā …pe…🔽ghānena gandhaṁ ghāyitvā …pe…
analyzed: sotena saddam sutvā pe  ghānena gandham ghāyitvā pe
translated: On hearing a sound with the ear …🔽On smelling an odor with the nose …

original: jivhāya rasaṁ sāyitvā …pe…
analyzed: jivhāya rasam sāyitvā pe
translated: On tasting a flavor with the tongue …

original: kāyena phoṭṭhabbaṁ phusitvā …pe…
analyzed: kāyena phoṭṭhabbam phusitvā pe
translated: On feeling a touch with the body …

original: manasā dhammaṁ viññāya mā nimittaggāhī hohi mānubyañjanaggāhī.
analyzed: manasā dhammam viññāya mā nimitta ggāhī hohi mā anubyañjana ggāhī
translated: On cognizing an idea with the mind, don’t grasp at its signs and features.

original: Yatvādhikaraṇamenaṁ manindriyaṁ asaṁvutaṁ viharantaṁ abhijjhādomanassā pāpakā akusalā🔽dhammā anvāssaveyyuṁ tassa saṁvarāya paṭipajjāhi; rakkhāhi manindriyaṁ, manindriye
analyzed: yatvā adhikaraṇam enam man indriyam viharantam abhijjhā domanassā pāpakāḥ akusalāḥ  dhammāḥ anvāssaveyyum tassa savarāya paṭipajjāhi rakkhāhi manindriya manindriye
translated: If you don’t guard your mind faculty, desire and aversion will overwhelm that faculty, and with the faculty unguarded, evil unskillful qualities such as greed and aversion will overwhelm you.

original: saṁvaraṁ āpajjāhī’ti.
analyzed: savaram āpajjāhi iti
translated: So practice for its restraint, guard the mind faculty, and undertake the restraint of the mind faculty.’

original: Yato kho, brāhmaṇa, bhikkhu indriyesu guttadvāro hoti, tamenaṁ tathāgato uttariṁ vineti:
analyzed: yatas kho brāhmaṇa bhikkhu indriyesu gutta dvāraḥ hoti tam enam tathāgataḥ uttarim vineti
translated: When a monk has guarded the doors of his senses, the Realized One teaches him further:

original: ‘ehi tvaṁ, bhikkhu, bhojane mattaññū hohi.🔽Paṭisaṅkhā yoniso āhāraṁ āhāreyyāsi—
analyzed: ehi tva bhikkhu bhojane mattaññū hohi  paṭisaṅkhā yonisaḥ āhāram āhāreyyā asi
translated: ‘Come, monk, be moderate in eating.

original: neva davāya na madāya na maṇḍanāya na vibhūsanāya, yāvadeva imassa kāyassa ṭhitiyā🔽yāpanāya vihiṁsūparatiyā brahmacariyānuggahāya—iti purāṇañca vedanaṁ paṭihaṅkhāmi,
analyzed: na iva davāya na madāya na maṇḍanāya na vibhūsanāya yāvat eva imassa kāyassa ṭhitiyā  yāpanāya brahmacariya anuggahāya eti purāṇam ca vedanam paṭihaṅkhāmi
translated: Reflecting wisely, you should take food neither for amusement nor for intoxication nor for the sake of physical beauty and attractiveness,

original: navañca vedanaṁ na uppādessāmi, yātrā ca me bhavissati anavajjatā ca phāsuvihāro cā’ti.
analyzed: navam ca vedanam na uppādessāmi yātrā ca me bhavissati anavajja tā ca phāsu vihāraḥ ca ati
translated: but only for the endurance and continuance of this body, for ending discomfort, and for assisting the holy life, considering: “Thus I shall terminate old feelings without arousing new feelings and I shall be healthy and blameless and shall live in comfort.”’

original: Yato kho, brāhmaṇa, bhikkhu bhojane mattaññū hoti, tamenaṁ tathāgato uttariṁ vineti:🔽‘ehi tvaṁ, bhikkhu, jāgariyaṁ anuyutto viharāhi, divasaṁ caṅkamena nisajjāya āvaraṇīyehi
analyzed: yatas kho brāhmaṇa bhikkhu bhojane mattaññū hoti tam enam tathāgataḥ uttarim vineti  ehi tva bhikkhu jāgariyam anuyuttaḥ viharāhi divasam caṅkamena nisajjāya āvaraṇīyehi
translated: When a monk is moderate in eating, the Realized One teaches him further:🔽‘Come, monk, be devoted to wakefulness.🔽During the day, while walking back and forth and sitting, purify your mind of obscurations.

original: dhammehi cittaṁ parisodhehi, rattiyā paṭhamaṁ yāmaṁ caṅkamena nisajjāya āvaraṇīyehi
analyzed: dhammehi cittam parisodhehi rattiyā paṭhamam yāmam caṅkamena nisajjāya āvaraṇīyehi
translated: In the first watch of the night, while walking back and forth and sitting, purify your mind of obscurations.

original: dhammehi cittaṁ parisodhehi, rattiyā majjhimaṁ yāmaṁ dakkhiṇena passena sīhaseyyaṁ🔽kappeyyāsi pāde pādaṁ accādhāya sato sampajāno uṭṭhānasaññaṁ manasikaritvā, rattiyā
analyzed: dhammehi cittam parisodhehi rattiyāḥ majjhimam yāmam dakkhiṇena passena sīhaseyya  kappeyyāsi pāde pādam accādhāya sataḥ sampajānaḥ uṭṭhāna saññam manasikaritvā rattiyā
translated: Purify your mind of hindrances with the four divine abodes. In the middle part of the night, lie down on the right side in the lion’s posture,🔽one foot overlapping the other, mindful and clearly comprehending, after noting in the mind the time for rising. After rising, in the last part of the night,

original: pacchimaṁ yāmaṁ paccuṭṭhāya caṅkamena nisajjāya āvaraṇīyehi dhammehi cittaṁ parisodhehī’ti.
analyzed: pacchimam yāmam paccuṭṭhāya caṅkamena nisajjāya āvaraṇīyehi dhammehi cittam parisodhehi iti
translated: while walking back and forth and sitting, purify your mind of hindrances with insight into the teachings.’

original: Yato kho, brāhmaṇa, bhikkhu jāgariyaṁ anuyutto hoti, tamenaṁ tathāgato uttariṁ vineti:
analyzed: yatas kho brāhmaṇa bhikkhu jāgariyam anuyuttaḥ hoti tam enam tathāgataḥ uttarim vineti
translated: “When a monk is devoted to staying awake, the Realized One teaches him further:🔽‘Come, monk, be endowed with mindfulness and clear comprehension.

original: ‘ehi tvaṁ, bhikkhu, satisampajaññena samannāgato hohi, abhikkante paṭikkante sampajānakārī,
analyzed: ehi tva bhikkhu sati sampajaññena samannāgataḥ hohi abhikkante paṭikkante sampajāna kārī
translated: Act with clear comprehension when going forward and returning.🔽Act with clear comprehension when looking ahead and looking around.🔽Act with clear comprehension when bending and stretching.

original: ālokite vilokite sampajānakārī, samiñjite pasārite sampajānakārī, saṅghāṭipattacīvaradhāraṇe
analyzed: ālokite vilokite sampajānakārī samiñjite pasārite sampajānakārī saṅghāṭi patta cīvara dhāraṇe
translated: Act with clear comprehension when wearing your robes and carrying your outer robe and bowl.🔽Act with clear comprehension when eating, drinking, consuming food, and tasting.

original: sampajānakārī, asite pīte khāyite sāyite sampajānakārī, uccārapassāvakamme sampajānakārī,
analyzed: sampajāna kārī asite pīte khāyite sāyite sampajāna kārī uccāra passāva kamme sampajāna kārī
translated: Act with clear comprehension when defecating and urinating.

original: gate ṭhite nisinne sutte jāgarite bhāsite tuṇhībhāve sampajānakārī’ti.
analyzed: gate ṭhite nisinne sutte jāgarite bhāsite tuṇhībhāve sampajāna kārī iti
translated: Act with clear comprehension when walking, standing, sitting, sleeping, waking, talking, and remaining silent.’”

original: Yato kho, brāhmaṇa, bhikkhu satisampajaññena samannāgato hoti, tamenaṁ tathāgato uttariṁ vineti:
analyzed: yatas kho brāhmaṇa bhikkhu sati sampajaññena samannāgataḥ hoti tam enam tathāgataḥ uttarim vineti
translated: “When a bhikkhu possesses mindfulness and full awareness, the Tathagata disciplines him further:

original: ‘ehi tvaṁ, bhikkhu, vivittaṁ senāsanaṁ bhajāhi araññaṁ rukkhamūlaṁ pabbataṁ kandaraṁ giriguhaṁ susānaṁ vanapatthaṁ abbhokāsaṁ palālapuñjan’ti.🔽So vivittaṁ senāsanaṁ bhajati araññaṁ rukkhamūlaṁ pabbataṁ kandaraṁ giriguhaṁ susānaṁ vanapatthaṁ abbhokāsaṁ palālapuñjaṁ.
analyzed: ehi tva bhikkhu vivittam senāsanam bhajāhi araññam rukkha mūlam pabbatam kandaram giri guham su sānam vana pattham abbhokāsam palāla puñjanti  so vivittam senāsanam bhajati araññam rukkha mūlam pabbatam kandaram giri guham su sānam vana pattham abbhokāsam palāla puñja
translated: ‘Come, bhikkhu, live in the forest.’🔽He lives in the forest, in an isolated dwelling place.

original: So pacchābhattaṁ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto nisīdati pallaṅkaṁ ābhujitvā, ujuṁ kāyaṁ paṇidhāya, parimukhaṁ satiṁ upaṭṭhapetvā.🔽So abhijjhaṁ loke pahāya vigatābhijjhena cetasā viharati, abhijjhāya cittaṁ parisodheti;
analyzed: saḥ pacchābhattam piṇḍapāta paṭikkantaḥ nisīdati pallaṅkam ābhujitvā ujum kāyam paṇidhāya parimukham satim upaṭṭhapetvā  saḥ abhijjham loke pahāya vigata abhijjhena cetasā viharati abhijjhāya cittam parisodheti
translated: After the meal, on his return from his alms round, he sits down. He folds his legs crosswise, sets his body erect, and establishes mindfulness in front of him.🔽Abandoning worldly desires, he dwells with a mind free from worldly desires; he purifies his mind of worldly desires.

original: byāpādapadosaṁ pahāya abyāpannacitto viharati sabbapāṇabhūtahitānukampī, byāpādapadosā cittaṁ parisodheti;
analyzed: byāpāda padosam pahāya a byāpanna cittaḥ viharati sabba pāṇa bhūta hita anukampī byāpāda padosā cittam parisodheti
translated: Abandoning sensual lust, he dwells with a mind free from sensual lust; he purifies his mind of sensual lust.

original: thinamiddhaṁ pahāya vigatathinamiddho viharati ālokasaññī sato sampajāno, thinamiddhā cittaṁ parisodheti;
analyzed: thinamiddham pahāya vigata thinamiddhaḥ viharati āloka saññī sataḥ sampajānaḥ thinamiddhā cittam parisodheti
translated: He gives up torpor and drowsiness, gets rid of them, eliminates them, and abolishes them. He dwells with an awareness devoid of torpor, mindful, alert, and sensitive. He purifies his mind of torpor and drowsiness.

original: uddhaccakukkuccaṁ pahāya anuddhato viharati ajjhattaṁ vūpasantacitto, uddhaccakukkuccā cittaṁ parisodheti;
analyzed: uddhacca kukkuccam pahāya anuddhataḥ viharati ajjhattam vūpasanta cittaḥ uddhacca kukkuccā cittam parisodheti
translated: He gives up restlessness and anxiety, dwells without anxiety, with a mind inwardly peaceful. He purifies his mind of restlessness and anxiety.

original: vicikicchaṁ pahāya tiṇṇavicikiccho viharati akathaṅkathī kusalesu dhammesu, vicikicchāya cittaṁ parisodheti.
analyzed: vicikiccham pahāya tiṇṇa vicikicchaḥ viharati a kathaṅkathī kusalesu dhammesu vicikicchāya cittam parisodheti
translated: He gives up doubt, crosses over uncertainty, and becomes free from perplexity about wholesome qualities. He purifies his mind of doubt.

original: So ime pañca nīvaraṇe pahāya cetaso upakkilese paññāya dubbalīkaraṇe
analyzed: saḥ ime pañca nīvaraṇe pahāya cetasaḥ upakkilese paññāya dubbalīkaraṇe
translated: He abandons these five hindrances, corruptions of the mind and weakeners of wisdom,🔽and with a mind that is open and uncovered, he dwells contemplating arising and vanishing in the five aggregates subject to clinging: ‘Such is form, such its origin, such its passing away; such is feeling … such is perception … such are volitional formations … such is consciousness, such its origin, such its passing away.’🔽As he dwells contemplating arising and vanishing in the five aggregates subject to clinging, the mind is liberated from the corruptions, and he directly knows: ‘Destroyed is birth, the holy life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no more for this state of being.’🔽This is the second knowledge he has attained.

original: vivicceva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaṁ savicāraṁ vivekajaṁ pītisukhaṁ paṭhamaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati.🔽Vitakkavicārānaṁ vūpasamā ajjhattaṁ sampasādanaṁ …pe… dutiyaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati.🔽Pītiyā ca virāgā … tatiyaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati.
analyzed: vivicca iva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi sa vitakkam sa vicāram viveka jam pīti sukham paṭhamam jhānam upasampajja viharati 🔽vitakka vicārānam vūpasamāḥ ajjhattam sampasādanam pe dutiyam jhānam upasampajja viharati 🔽pītiyā ca virāgā tatiyam jhānam upasampajja viharati
translated: With the fading away as well of rapture, he dwells equanimous and, mindful and clearly aware, he experiences happiness with the body; he enters and dwells in the third jhāna of which the noble ones declare: ‘He is equanimous, mindful, one who dwells happily.’🔽This is the third knowledge he has attained.

original: Sukhassa ca pahānā … catutthaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati.
analyzed: sukhassa ca pahānā catuttham jhānam upasampajja viharati
translated: On the dissolution of the body, after death, he reappears in a happy destiny, in the heavenly world.

original: Ye kho te, brāhmaṇa, bhikkhū sekkhā apattamānasā anuttaraṁ yogakkhemaṁ patthayamānā viharanti tesu me ayaṁ evarūpī anusāsanī hoti.🔽Ye pana te bhikkhū arahanto khīṇāsavā vusitavanto katakaraṇīyā ohitabhārā anuppattasadatthā🔽parikkhīṇabhavasaṁyojanā sammadaññāvimuttā tesaṁ ime dhammā diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārāya
analyzed: ye kho te brāhmaṇa bhikkhū sekkhāḥ a patta mānasāḥ anuttaram yogakkhemam patthayamānāḥ viharanti tesu me ayam evarūpī anusāsanī hoti  ye pana te bhikkhū arahantaḥ khīṇa āsavāḥ vusitavantaḥ kata karaṇīyāḥ ohita bhārāḥ anuppatta sadatthā  parikkhīṇa bhava sayojanā sammad aññā vimuttā tesam ime dhammā diṭṭhadhamma sukha vihārāya
translated: This is the kind of instruction I give to those bhikkhus who are in training, who have not attained their heart’s ideal, who dwell aspiring to the unsurpassed security from bondage.

original: ceva saṁvattanti, satisampajaññāya cā”ti.
analyzed: ca iva savattanti sati sampajaññāya ca ati
translated: But for those bhikkhus who are arahants with taints destroyed, who have lived the holy life, done what had to be done, laid down the burden, reached the true goal, destroyed the fetters of being, and are completely liberated through final knowledge, these things lead to a pleasant abiding here and now and to mindfulness and full awareness.

original: Evaṁ vutte, gaṇakamoggallāno brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte gaṇakamoggallānaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: “When this was said, the brahmin Ganaka Moggallana said to the Blessed One:

original: “kiṁ nu kho bhoto gotamassa sāvakā bhotā gotamena evaṁ ovadīyamānā evaṁ anusāsīyamānā sabbe accantaṁ niṭṭhaṁ nibbānaṁ ārādhenti udāhu ekacce nārādhentī”ti?
analyzed: kim nu kho bhoto gotamassa sāvakāḥ bhotā gotamena evam ovadīyamānāḥ evam anusāsīyamānā sabbe accantam niṭṭham nibbānam ārādhenti udāhu ekacce na ārādhenti iti
translated: “Now, does Master Gotama instruct only those disciples in whose minds the net of conceit has been cut, or does he instruct all disciples?”

original: “Appekacce kho, brāhmaṇa, mama sāvakā mayā evaṁ ovadīyamānā evaṁ anusāsīyamānā accantaṁ niṭṭhaṁ nibbānaṁ ārādhenti, ekacce nārādhentī”ti.
analyzed: appa ekacce kho brāhmaṇa mama sāvakāḥ mayā evam ovadīyamānāḥ evam anusāsīyamānāḥ accantam niṭṭham nibbānam ārādhenti ekacce na ārādhenti iti
translated: “Brahmin, some of my disciples, when thus advised and instructed by me, attain the uttermost confidence in me, while others do not.”

original: “Ko nu kho, bho gotama, hetu ko paccayo yaṁ tiṭṭhateva nibbānaṁ, tiṭṭhati nibbānagāmī maggo, tiṭṭhati bhavaṁ gotamo samādapetā;
analyzed: kaḥ nu kho bho gotama hetu kaḥ paccayaḥ yat tiṭṭhatā iva nibbāna tiṭṭhati nibbāna gāmī maggo tiṭṭhati bhavam gotamaḥ samādapetā
translated: “What is the reason, Master Gotama, what is the cause why Nibbāna exists, the path leading to Nibbāna exists, and Master Gotama exists to exhort,

original: atha ca pana bhoto gotamassa sāvakā bhotā gotamena evaṁ ovadīyamānā evaṁ anusāsīyamānā appekacce accantaṁ niṭṭhaṁ nibbānaṁ ārādhenti, ekacce nārādhentī”ti?
analyzed: atha ca pana bhotaḥ gotamassa sāvakāḥ bhotā gotamena evam ovadīyamānāḥ evam anusāsīyamānāḥ appekacce accantam niṭṭham nibbānam ārādhenti ekacce na ārādhenti iti
translated: yet some of Master Gotama’s disciples, when thus advised and instructed by him, attain the uttermost confidence in him, while others do not?”

original: “Tena hi, brāhmaṇa, taṁyevettha paṭipucchissāmi. Yathā te khameyya tathā naṁ byākareyyāsi.
analyzed: tena hi brāhmaṇa tayā iva itthā paṭipucchissāmi yathā te khameyya tathā nam byākareyyāsi
translated: “Well then, brahmin, I will question you about this matter. Answer as you see fit.

original: Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, brāhmaṇa,
analyzed: tam kim maññasi brāhmaṇa
translated: What do you think, brahmin?

original: kusalo tvaṁ rājagahagāmissa maggassā”ti?

translated: Are you skilled in the path leading to Rājagaha?”

analyzed: eva bho kusalaḥ aham rājagaha gāmissa maggassa ati
translated: “Yes, sir, I am skilled in the path leading to Rājagaha.”

original: “Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, brāhmaṇa,
analyzed: tam kim maññasi brāhmaṇa
translated: “What do you think, brahmin?

translated: go a little further and you’ll see Rājagaha with its delightful parks, groves, meadows, and ponds.’

translated: What is the reason, brahmin, what is the cause why Rājagaha remains as it is, the road to Rājagaha remains as it is, and you remain as you are, advising?

translated: But if one of them were to go off the path and wander around lost, while the other were to go to Rājagaha in safety?”

analyzed: ettha kyā āha bho gotama karomi
translated: “What can I do about it, Master Gotama?

analyzed: magga khāyī iha bho gotama ati
translated: I’m just a guide to the path.”

translated: But even though my disciples are instructed and taught by me in this way, some of them attain Nibbāna, the ultimate goal, and some do not.

original: Ettha kyāhaṁ, brāhmaṇa, karomi?
analyzed: ettha kyā āha brāhmaṇa karomi
translated: What can I do about it, brahmin?

original: Maggakkhāyīhaṁ, brāhmaṇa, tathāgato”ti.
analyzed: magga khāyī iha brāhmaṇa tathāgataḥ ti
translated: I’m just a guide to the path, brahmin, a Tathāgata.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, gaṇakamoggallāno brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte gaṇakamoggallānaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: When this was said, the brahmin Gaṇaka Moggallāna said to the Blessed One:

original: “yeme, bho gotama, puggalā assaddhā jīvikatthā na saddhā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajitā
analyzed: ye me bho gotama puggalāḥ assaddhāḥ jīvikatthāḥ na saddhāḥ agārasma anagāriyam pabbajitā
translated: “There are, Master Gotama, some ascetics and brahmins who are without faith, conscience, prudence, or wisdom.

original: saṭhā māyāvino ketabino uddhatā unnaḷā capalā mukharā vikiṇṇavācā indriyesu aguttadvārā
analyzed: saṭhāḥ māyāvino ketabinaḥ uddhatāḥ unnaḷāḥ capalāḥ mukharāḥ vikiṇṇa vācāḥ indriyesu a gutta dvārāḥ
translated: they are deceitful, fraudulent, treacherous, haughty, arrogant, fickle, garrulous, with loose tongues, with uncontrolled senses,

original: bhojane amattaññuno jāgariyaṁ ananuyuttā sāmaññe anapekkhavanto sikkhāya na tibbagāravā
analyzed: bhojane amattaññunaḥ jāgariyam an anuyuttā sāmaññe an apekkhavantaḥ sikkhāya na tibba gāravā
translated: they are not moderate in eating, they are not devoted to wakefulness, they are not concerned with asceticism, they do not have great respect for the training,

original: bāhulikā sāthalikā okkamane pubbaṅgamā paviveke nikkhittadhurā kusītā hīnavīriyā
analyzed: bāhulikā sāthalikā okkamane pubbaṅgamā paviveke nikkhitta dhurā kusītā hīna vīriyā
translated: they are luxurious and lax, leaders in backsliding, shirkers of responsibility, idlers, drifters, lazy, lacking in energy,

original: muṭṭhassatino asampajānā asamāhitā vibbhantacittā duppaññā eḷamūgā, na tehi bhavaṁ🔽gotamo saddhiṁ saṁvasati.
analyzed: muṭṭha ssatinaḥ asampajānāḥ asamāhitāḥ vibbhanta cittāḥ duppaññāḥ eḷamūgāḥ na tehi bhava  gotamaḥ saddhim savasati
translated: they are unmindful, lacking in clear knowing, unconcentrated, with wandering minds, lacking in wisdom, dull, stupid, the Fortunate One does not live together with them.

original: Ye pana te kulaputtā saddhā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajitā asaṭhā amāyāvino aketabino
analyzed: ye pana te kula puttā saddhāḥ agārasma anagāriyam pabbajitāḥ a saṭhāḥ a māyāvinaḥ a ketabinaḥ
translated: But those who are faithful, who have gone forth from the home to homelessness, not deceitful, not fraudulent, not treacherous,

original: anuddhatā anunnaḷā acapalā amukharā avikiṇṇavācā indriyesu guttadvārā bhojane mattaññuno
analyzed: an uddhatāḥ an unnaḷāḥ a capalāḥ a mukharāḥ a vikiṇṇa vācāḥ indriyesu gutta dvārāḥ bhojane mattaññunaḥ
translated: not haughty, not arrogant, not fickle, not garrulous, not with loose tongues, with controlled senses, moderate in eating,

original: jāgariyaṁ anuyuttā sāmaññe apekkhavanto sikkhāya tibbagāravā nabāhulikā nasāthalikā
analyzed: jāgariyam anuyuttā sāmaññe apekkhavantaḥ sikkhāya tibba gāravā na bāhulikāḥ na sāthalikā
translated: devoted to wakefulness, concerned with asceticism, having great respect for the training, not luxurious and lax, not leaders in backsliding,

original: okkamane nikkhittadhurā paviveke pubbaṅgamā āraddhavīriyā pahitattā upaṭṭhitassatino
analyzed: okkamane nikkhitta dhurā paviveke pubbaṅgamāḥ āraddha vīriyāḥ pahita ttāḥ upaṭṭhita ssatino
translated: They are not leaders in decline, but leaders in seclusion. They are energetic, resolute, and mindful.

original: sampajānā samāhitā ekaggacittā paññavanto aneḷamūgā, tehi bhavaṁ gotamo saddhiṁ saṁvasati.
analyzed: sampajānā samāhitāḥ ekagga cittāḥ paññavantaḥ an eḷamūgāḥ tehi bhavam gotamaḥ saddhim savasati
translated: They are wise, not confused. The reverend Gotama lives together with them.

original: Seyyathāpi, bho gotama, ye keci mūlagandhā, kālānusāri tesaṁ aggamakkhāyati;🔽ye keci sāragandhā, lohitacandanaṁ tesaṁ aggamakkhāyati;
analyzed: seyyathā api bho gotama ye keci mūla gandhā kālānusāri tesam aggam akkhāyati  ye keci sāra gandhāḥ lohita candanam tesam aggam akkhāyati
translated: Just as, sir, among fragrances derived from grass or wood,🔽the fragrance of white sandalwood is considered best,

original: ye keci pupphagandhā, vassikaṁ tesaṁ aggamakkhāyati;
analyzed: ye keci puppha gandhāḥ vassikam tesam aggam akkhāyati
translated: among fragrances derived from flowers, the fragrance of jasmine is considered best,

original: evameva bhoto gotamassa ovādo paramajjadhammesu.
analyzed: evam eva bhoto gotamassa ovādaḥ paramajja dhammesu
translated: so too is the instruction of the reverend Gotama the best among those of good conduct.

original: Abhikkantaṁ, bho gotama, abhikkantaṁ, bho gotama.
analyzed: abhikkanta bho gotama abhikkanta bho gotama
translated: Excellent, sir Gotama, excellent!

original: Seyyathāpi, bho gotama, nikkujjitaṁ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṁ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa
analyzed: seyyathā api bho gotama nikkujjitam vā ukkujjeyya paṭicchannam vā vivareyya mūḷhassa
translated: Just as, sir, one might set upright what has been overturned,

original: vā maggaṁ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṁ dhāreyya: ‘cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī’ti;
analyzed: vā maggam ācikkheyya andhakāre vā tela pajjotam dhāreyya cakkhumantaḥ rūpāni dakkhanti iti
translated: or reveal what has been hidden, or show the way to one who is lost, or bring a lamp into the darkness so that one with eyes might see what is there—

original: evamevaṁ bhotā gotamena anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
analyzed: evam evam bhotā gotamena aneka pariyāyena dhammo pakāsito
translated: just so has the Dhamma been explained by the reverend Gotama in countless ways.

original: Esāhaṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
analyzed: esā aham bhavantam gotamam saraṇam gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhu saṅghañca
translated: I go for refuge to Master Gotama, to the Dhamma, and to the Sangha of bhikkhus.

original: Upāsakaṁ maṁ bhavaṁ gotamo dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṁ saraṇaṁ gatan”ti.
analyzed: upāsakam mam bhavam gotamaḥ dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetam saraṇam gatanti
translated: Let Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”

original: Gaṇakamoggallānasuttaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ sattamaṁ.
analyzed: gaṇakamoggallāna suttam niṭṭhitam sattama
translated: The Sutta on Gaṇaka-Moggallāna is finished.
